001package com.technototes.library.subsystem.drivebase;
002
003import com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.DcMotorSimple;
004import com.technototes.library.hardware.motor.Motor;
005import com.technototes.library.hardware.motor.MotorGroup;
006import com.technototes.library.subsystem.DeviceSubsystem;
007import java.util.function.DoubleSupplier;
008
009/**
010 * Class for DriveBase subsystems
011 *
012 * @param <T> The type of motors for the drivebase
013 * @author Alex Stedman The motors for the drivebase
014 */
015public abstract class DrivebaseSubsystem<T extends DcMotorSimple>
016    extends DeviceSubsystem<MotorGroup<T>> {
017
018    /**
019     * Override this to get the gyroscope heading.
020     * Or pass it in to the constructor. Which ever works best for your drivebase implementation.
021     */
022    protected DoubleSupplier gyroSupplier = () -> 0;
023
024    /**
025     * Create a drivebase subsystem
026     *
027     * @param motors The drive motors
028     */
029    public DrivebaseSubsystem(Motor<T>... motors) {
030        super(new MotorGroup<T>(motors));
031    }
032
033    /**
034     * Create a drivebase subsystem
035     *
036     * @param gyro   The gyro supplier
037     * @param motors The drive motors
038     */
039    public DrivebaseSubsystem(DoubleSupplier gyro, Motor<T>... motors) {
040        super(new MotorGroup<T>(motors));
041        gyroSupplier = gyro;
042    }
043
044    /**
045     * This will give you a *positive* value to scale the value to such that
046     * the largest value of the list will be |1| (negative or positive).
047     * <p>
048     * This is helpful for an X-Drive drivebase, as the algorithm for calucating
049     * motor power will often give a collection of values, all of which are smaller than 1.
050     *
051     * @param powers The list of values you're setting
052     * @return The number to divide the values by to set the largest to 1/-1
053     */
054    public double getScale(double... powers) {
055        double max = 0;
056        for (double d : powers) {
057            max = Math.max(Math.abs(d), max);
058        }
059        return max;
060    }
061
062    /**
063     * Get the Gyro angle
064     *
065     * @return Gyro angle from supplier
066     */
067    public double getGyro() {
068        return gyroSupplier.getAsDouble();
069    }
070
071    /**
072     * Override this one, I guess? Not sure how useful it is.
073     *
074     * @return the speed?
075     */
076    public double getSpeed() {
077        return 1;
078    }
079}
